title: Train carrying iron ore derails in San Bernardino County, California
description: A train carrying raw material derailed in California on Monday, according to San Bernardino County fire officials.

title: N. Carolina governor signs Medicaid expansion bill into law
description: North Carolina Democratic Gov. Roy Cooper has signed a Medicaid expansion law that was a decade in the making

title: Family of US couple kidnapped in Haiti plea for release
description: The family of a U.S. couple who has been kidnapped in Haiti is pleading for their release

title: At least 20 dead when bus hits bridge, burns in Saudi Arabia
description: State media in Sauid Arabia say at least 20 people were killed when a packed bus hit a bridge, overturned and burst into flames in the country's southwest

title: New source of water found in moon samples from China mission
description: Scientists have discovered a new and renewable source of water on the moon for future explorers in lunar samples returned from a Chinese mission

title: Terry Sanderson testifies in Gwyneth Paltrow ski crash trial
description: Terry Sanderson, the man taking Gwyneth Paltrow to court over a 2016 ski crash, testified in court Monday during the civil trial.

title: WATCH:  Corgis get VIP tour of Madame Tussauds’ new Royal Palace attraction
description: Nine corgis got to see wax figures of the Royal Family ahead of King Charles III’s coronation.

title: Timeline: How the Nashville shooting at Covenant School unfolded
description: Police said 14 minutes passed between the time they got a 911 call about a shooter at a Christian school outside Nashville and the suspect's death.

title: George Washington University to replace controversial 'Colonials' moniker
description: Students said the name had a negative connotation regarding violence toward Native Americans.

title: Train derails in rural North Dakota and spills chemical
description: A Canadian Pacific train derailed in rural North Dakota Sunday night and spilled some hazardous materials, but local authorities and the railroad said there is no threat to public safety

title: Restaurant owner describes the moment she saved her staff from tornado
description: Tracy Harden, the owner of Chuck's Dairy Bar in Rolling Fork, Mississippi, rushed her staff into a cooler moments before a tornado hit.

title: Fox News producer who sued network says she's been fired
description: The Fox News producer who sued the network last week alleging she was "coerced" into giving false testimony against Dominion Voting Systems says she has now been fired.

title: Twitter celebs balk at paying Elon Musk for blue check mark
description: William Shatner, Monica Lewinsky and other prolific Twitter commentators — some household names, others little-known journalists — could soon be losing the blue check marks that helped verify their identity on the social media platform

title: Multiple patients reported amid 'active aggressor' at Nashville school
description: The Nashville Fire Department is reporting multiple patients from an "active aggressor" at a private school in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: Sheriff: Man who fled traffic shot shoots officer in Florida
description: Sheriff's officials say a man who sped away from a traffic stop in Florida last week shot and critically wounded a sheriff’s officer before killing himself during a standoff at his home

title: Louvre staff block entrances as part of pension protest
description: The Louvre Museum in Paris has been closed to the public because its workers took part in the wave of French protest strikes against the government’s unpopular pension reform plans

title: Russian shelling of Ukraine city kills 2, wounds 29 people
description: Officials in Ukraine say two people were killed and 29 wounded when Russian forces shelled the Ukrainian city of Sloviansk, in the partially occupied eastern Donetsk region

title: South reels from deadly tornado outbreak as new storm takes aim in the West
description: Over the weekend, at least 27 tornadoes were reported across five states -- Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, Georgia and Tennessee.

title: Elizabeth Warren running for 3rd US Senate term in 2024
description: Massachusetts Democratic U.S. Sen. Elizabeth Warren has announced she will seek a third term in 2024

title: Alibaba's Jack Ma returns to mainland China
description: Alibaba founder Jack Ma has resurfaced in China after months of overseas travel, visiting a school in the eastern city of Hangzhou where he discussed various topics including artificial intelligence

title: Israel's airport departures suspended amid public outcry over justice reform bill
description: Protesters streamed on to Israel's streets overnight, as thousands voiced their opposition to a controversial justice reform bill.

title: WATCH:  Car flips after being hit by flying tire
description: Police said no major injuries were sustained in the dramatic incident in Los Angeles.

title: Iraqi parliament passes controversial vote law amendments
description: Iraqi lawmakers have passed controversial amendments to the country's election law that could undermine the chances for smaller parties and independent candidates to win seats in future polls

title: 2 dead, 5 injured in shootings at 2 Little Rock locations, police say
description: Two people were killed and five were injured in a pair of shootings in Little Rock, Arkansas, on Sunday evening, local police said.

title: In Macron's France, streets and fields seethe with protest
description: Protesting is a rite of passage in France and again the rage

title: Deputies accused of shoving guns in mouths of 2 Black men
description: Police and court records obtained by The Associated Press show that deputies who were accepted to a Mississippi sheriff's department's special tactical unit have been involved in at least four violent encounters with Black men since 2019 that left two ...

title: Taiwan's former leader Ma begins China visit
description: Former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou departed for a 12-day tour of China Monday, a day after Taiwan lost another of its 14 diplomatic partners to China

title: First Citizens to buy $72 billion in assets of failed Silicon Valley Bank, FDIC says
description: First Citizens Bank will buy about $72 billion in assets from the failed Silicon Valley Bank, the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation said.

title: Twitter: parts of its source code leaked online
description: Some parts of Twitter’s source code _ the fundamental computer code on which the social network runs _ were leaked online, the social media company said in a legal filing on Sunday that was first reported by The New York Times

title: Mass protests erupt after Netanyahu fires defense chief
description: Tens of thousands of Israelis have poured into the streets across the country in a spontaneous outburst of anger after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu abruptly fired his defense minister for challenging the Israeli leader’s judicial overhaul plan
